Personally ranked as the best video game ever made. If not for some very minor bugs on release, my experience with this would have been flawless. Sci-fi fans out there, if you haven't played this game, you are missing out.

The game is short but the length is perfect. You will come out of enraptured, wanting for more and the best part of it is that Portal 2 is now here, ready and waiting for you and it lives up to the titanic expections set by its predecessor.

Noting this down HUGE SUCSESS,

Génial! Bon, il faut quand même aimer les puzzles games. Et le jeu est très court

Mais l'ambiance est énorme, il faut le jouer en VF car, même si vous êtes bon anglophone et adepte des VO, quand ce n'est pas votre langue maternel vous passez forcément à côté de petits détails et de petites phrases.
Et justement, ce jeu est bourré de phrases mythiques proférés par Glados l'intéligence artificielle qui vous évalue, et avec qui vous allez petit à petit nouer une relation... disons... surprenante!

J'ai passé le jeu entier avec un sacré sourir aux lèvres, tellement Glados et son comportement est halucinant.

Et surtout, scénaristiquement, le jeu fini par prendre une tournure inatendue qui va bien au delà du puzzle game. Sacré surprise!!

A not-to-hard game that can be a little bit challenging but it doesn't upset you too much.
A first person shooter game that won't let you shoot bullets, but portals you can pass through to solve puzzles among the chambers of a mysterious "scientific" test chambers in an automated laboratory, wich is (or was) in competition with the well known Black Mesa Research Facility from Half Life.
Constantly teased by an electronic voice from a computer known as GLaDOS, you don't remember who you are, why you are there and what is the feeling of being alone though you are observed.
Solve tests, clear stages and pry the story behind the walls and the observation windows of the test chambers.
It's totally worth it and, ironically, after playing this you must play the sequel too or you won't fully understand its plot and its meaning.
Good physics, graphics and easter eggs.
And don't forget about the cake...
I've heard nothing but good things from this game. I can see why.
Прекрасная пространственная головоломка, которая заставляет шевелиться шестеренкам в мозгу. Ну и, конечно, комментарии Гладос - великолепны.
The most awesome non-shooter I have ever played.

Ahh portal. 

Depending on your gaming nature this may be a love or hate game. Trippy, atmospheric and conniving.

I wonder what this would be like if you were on drugs?!

Portal - это прекрасная игра. Она очень меня порадывала своей необычностью и сюжетом. Это конечно, не та игра, в которой всех надо убивать и устраивать кровавое месиво, это СОВСЕМ другое, тут надо мозгами шевелить. Советую всем купить эту игру и насладиться ею!

The one that started it all. Your cake and grief counselling awaits.

Let me get this straight...  You're on Steam, and don't own Portal yet?
Okay.  Portal is a game that was originally included in The Orange Box as an extra and now has grown into itself as its own game and sequel.  It's an excellent little game made back when Source was just a baby engine.  The story is amazing and just kinda sneaks up on you.  It is not CPU or GPU intensive, and it is available on all 3 PC platforms.

I give this game 5/5 morality cores for having a good story and mechanics, because there's really not much else this game could have.

Долго откладывал прохождение этой игры, так как думал, что она мне не понравится. Я еще никогда так не ошибался!
Плюсы:
+ Абсолютно все! Я даже не знаю, что конкретно здесь описывать, но постараюсь.
+ Отличный сюжет. Действующих лиц так мало, но это не помешало игре оставться захватывающей на всем ее протяжении.
+ Гениальный геймплей. Идея порталов, способы их использования и прочее-прочее - все это гениально.
+ Графика радует глаз даже после стольких лет после выхода. Я считаю, что это очень похвально.
+ Дополнительные уровни для задротства, а также различные режимы прохождения комнат все для тех же целей.
Минусы:
- Только один - игра очень короткая, можно пройти часа за три. Ради получения достижений придется потратить еще где-то часов 5-6.
This game is a bundle of win EVERYONE should play! With awesome gameplay, hilarious dialogue, an insane amount of charm and more, it's a game that shall go down in history as one of the greatest!
Highly recommended, best game EU
Best game ever
Awesome game Valve, but its kinda disappointing it doesnt have a Steam-Workshop for the Portal mods. 8/10

This game is so addicting! Hours will be spent being teased by GLaDOS, Loving the companion cupe, and of course, making portals. I strongly recommend this game!

A true masterpiece.

Portal es uno de los juegos basados en puzzles más famosos que hay por el momento y sin duda alguna si te encanta los puzzles lo tiene que comprar.

El juego es corto pero muy divertido.

Un juego bastante bueno, merece la pena si lo compras con la Portal Bundle. A pesar de su corta duración de 3 horas de historia + extras, te mete dentro del personaje, tal como si fuese una película. Te mantiene intrigado desde el principio, pensando tal y como si fueses el protagonista: ¿Que hago aquí?¿Que es esa voz?¿Dónde estoy?

Además tiene una complejidad de puzzles perfecta, en el modo historia tienen una dificultad normal, complicados pero que a la  vez te deja disfrutar de la historia.

PROS:
-Buena historia
-No necesita buenos gráficos
-Puzzles extras

CONTRAS:
-Duración

The game is fun and overall great. Well done.

A game unlike any other (excluding... pretty much any 3D action-puzzler since 20XX), Portal was the game that got me into any game that wasn't some sort of casual browser game. Great use of atmosphere (wear headphones!), controlled-to-be-awesome gameplay, and one of the few games to become a cultural landmark (too many memes). Somewhat short, but very clever on all fronts. The developer commentary gives some interesting insight into portal-rendering and difficulty progression.

ah, the minigame inside of half life. very amusing, and dark, the computer running the tests is kind of creepy, then you find out she's trying to kill you and that explains her attitude. puzzles are challenging, and graphics are in line with the time they were meant for. playing the sequel really makes sense of everything.

Portal is a first person action game of logic and strategy developed by Valve in 2007 and released in a package called The Orange Box .

The player wakes up in a glass room , the Aperture Science development center, where he is subjected to a series of experiments until ...... well I will not spoil the  game ....
Each experiment is guided by Glados voice, the mainframe development center computer. Glados is one of the best virtual characters in recent years. That computer has more personality than many humans from other games.

Throughout the game the player acquires a portal gun. This gun allows you to create portals, to enter and exit portals in order to go forward in the game, which requires solving logic puzzles to advance. You will  acquire a good sense of physics, position and movement.

The game is a marvel of Valves creativity. Many would prefer to kill zombies in left 4 dead , but personally, I think games like Portal are those who write history. The game lasts a few hours and when it finishes,  with music and lyrics, it makes you want to stand and applaud. No other game in recent years has touched me so much when it ended. It is an ode to creativity.

Its sequel , Portal 2, expands the concept of the game and makes it much longer, making it a standalone game. The Portal 2 was named Game of the Year in 2011 for various publications.

The game was released for Windows PC , PS3 and XBOX 360 before being ported to MAC OSX.

Now that I've finished the review I want my cake ! .

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ESPAÑOL
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Portal es un videojuego de lógica y estrategia en primera persona desarrollado por Valve en 2007 y lanzado en un paquete llamado Orange Box. 

El jugador despierta en una sala de cristal, el centro de desarrollo de Aperture Science, donde es sometido a una serie de experimentos hasta que …… no les voy a arruinar el juego....
En cada experimento lo va guiando una voz, que es Glados, la computadora central del centro de desarrollo. Glados es uno de los mejores personajes virtuales de los últimos años. Esta computadora tiene más personalidad que muchos humanos de otros juegos.

A lo largo del juego el jugador adquiere una pistola de portales. Esta pistola de portales le permite generar portales para entrar y salir por donde le es posible e ir avanzando en el juego, que requiere resolver acertijos lógicos para seguir adelante. Para ello hay que adquirir un buen sentido de la física, la posición y el movimiento.

El juego es una maravilla de la creatividad de Valve. Quizas muchos prefieran matar zombies como en el left 4 dead, pero personalmente creo que juegos como el Portal son los que escriben la historia. Finalmente al terminar en unas pocas horas, con musica y letra, dan ganas de pararse y aplaudir. Ningun juego posterior a portal me emocionó tanto. Es una oda a la creatividad.

Su secuela, el Portal 2 amplía el concepto del juego y lo hace mucho más largo, convirtiéndolo en un juego independiente. El Portal 2 fue nombrado Juego del Año en 2011 por diversas publicaciones. 

El juego se lanzó para PC bajo Windows, PS3 y XBOX 360 para luego ser portado a MAC OSX. 

Ahora que terminé el review quiero mi torta!.

Portal, zerei este game a 3 dias e tenho muito a dizer.
Quem já jogou e curtiu Half-Life provavelmente vai gostar de Portal. 
No começo o jogo pode pensar que só mais um arcade cheio de quebra-cabeças com uma narração de voz feminina computadorizada, não muito interessante(mas engraçada), mas logo na metade, se não me engano, já da para começa sentir a "alma" do jogo, como em Half-Life. O jogo possui uma história um tanto misteriosa com pequenas menções a Half-Life, pois os dois se passam no mesmo universo. O que mais me impressiona é que o jogo tem um incrível clima de filme de ficção-científica, aquele sobre testes em humanos e maquinas, e tudo isso sem uma cutscene durante todo o jogo (somente a do final).
Concluindo, é um ótimo jogo, recomendo a todos, principalmente aos fãs de Half-Life e até mesmo aos fãs de jogos com quebra-cabeças interessantes.
Zerei mesmo o jogo, mas se escrevi alguma besteira na Análise me avisem nos comentários. Obrigado.
7/10. Did enjoy it.
Portal is yet another iconic work from Valve built around a great storyline and gripping humour. A must for any puzzle (plus cake) lovers!
Muy buen juego

A really well-rounded game about...well, portals. Pretty low play-time, (4.3 hours logged for me, and I beat all the normal and advanced maps), but if you got it with the Orange Box, it kinda makes up for it. Neat graphics and a rather unusual sense of humor top this game off. 4.5/5 from me.
Um jogo muito bom, com uma história maravilhosa e jogabilidade que nem se fala, recomendo a todos que gostam de um bom jogo.

I never really submitted to the hype around this game, but recently it was on sale so I decided to get it and Portal 2. I enjoyed it more than I imagined I would! I went in not expecting much from the game but I absolutely loved it. The subtle storyline, the puzzles, everything was done so well. I have finished the game and I can't wait to do the bonus' and then continue onto Portal 2. :)
A short first-person puzzle game that makes you think outside the Aperture Science Weighted Storage Cube to solve puzzles.
its a special puzzle game of its on kind
Orange. Blue. Thinking with puzzles. 'Nuff said.
Muy buen juego, la unica pega que es demasiado corto, el 2 supera con creces a este

Um jogo que surgiu para ser apenas um teste que acabou tomando o mundo dos games de forma impressionante. A história misteriosa ligada ao universo Half-life fez com que a sequência desse jogo se tornasse um dos mais aguardados depois de HL2. 
Não é um jogo que tem ação o tempo todo, é um jogo onde você tem que pensar muito para resolver os testes e a cada câmara que passa a história vai se desenrolando até chegar ao momento cara-a-cara com a GLaDOS. 
GLaDOS que é uma supermáquina que controla todo laboratório e conduz os testes sádicos visando sempre evolução científica.

Pra quem gosta de usar o cérebro, histórias envolventes e um pouco mais de sussego ambiental, esse é o jogo!
Un des meilleurs jeux de tous les temps
Play it

Un poco corto pero solo hay una frase para describirlo "obra maestra" lo recomiendo a cualquiera.Tiene una idea increible, exelente banda sonora, uno de los mejores villanos de toda la historia de los videojuegos

I remember coming across a trailer for the Orange Box and wanting this game right then. I originally bought it in the PS3 version – the port was terrible, but the game got me hooked. The Rat Man drawings, “the cake is a lie”, and all of the ending (not spoiling), it all resonated with me, and I came back for another serving of the Portal cake sometime later, on Steam. It’s an instant classic, extremely original and well made, and I love the fact that I was there from the beginning, at least for once.

Después de la diversión inicial con el arma de portales, el juego carece de demasiadas cosas que lo hacen más una demo técnica que un juego.

Los mapas a resolver son demasiados fáciles y no exprimen el invento de los portales. Por otro lado la historia tiene algo de gracia pero al ser de tan poca duración se queda en algo anecdótico.

Крутая идея, отличная реализация - учитывая то, что Portal выросла из студенческой работы, можно сказать, что игра определённо удалась. Единственная эмоция, которая остаётся после прохождения игры - восторг от простой идеи, которая не приходила в голову никому до этого. Но хочется сказать, что игра очень короткая, поэтому цена в 200 рублей кажется слегка завышенной. Лично я взял комплект из двух частей на распродаже и остался доволен покупкой, но это личное дело каждого. Рекомендуется к прохождению.

A budget title that won the hearts of millions with its clever writing. Given that the game came packed alongside Half-Life 2 and all its episode expansions, it's amazing to see how much higher it's praised than they are. If you're playing Portal for its humor, you'd probably really hate it if a puzzle room stopped your progress for very long. And yet hardly anyone's complained about this. Throw in a woeful lack of any significant scene development, and you've got yourself a 2007 GOTY.
Complete different tests using your portal gun. Pretty fun and challenging, but too short in my opinion.

Alone in its category and revolutionary in its concept, Portal is a game that any serious gamer should play from start to finish at least once.

Simple and elegant mechanics and fluid gameplay combine with a sophisticated puzzle style, impeccable design and a dash of clever, dark humour. Only two characters populate the antiseptic world of Portal---one of them never actually speaks---but that does not substract from its well-planned drama and immersive experience.

The graphics are excellent for its time and still serviceable for modern audiences. Controls are easy and the "tutorial" vast and adequate. You will find yourself very soon immersed in this strange, mysterious world if you are to give it a short try.

Short by today's standards, the story is nevertheless rich and compelling. The voice acting is top-notch and the music simple but adequate.

A mandatory step in the process of understanding videogame history, Portal is a true classic that even years after its initial release never fails to deliver.

Unconditionally recommended.
Разумеется чтобы получить ещё большее удовольствие от Portal 2 желательно сначала пройти Portal

Portal is still a game worth playing through on its own. A great game, a bit on the short side, but it might've sucked if it was longer and it's only $9.99 after all.

Much like Braid, it uses simple gameplay mechanics and makes you use them in ways you didn't think was possible at first in order to reach new places.

And the game does have a sense of humor. Portal is great!

It moves air quite well and is not too noisy considering how powerful it is, but the angle adjustment on it is quite frustrating sometimes.

Favorite game of all time right here. The game starts out perfectly, with you waking up in a chamber to a female voice talking to you over the speaker. As you progress through the game, there's this creepy ambiance that never leaves. The OST also fits the game perfectly. It's not meant to distract from the game, it just compliments it. The lore behind this game is some of the best out there. If you have somehow never played this game, you owe it to yourself to try it. Not only is it fun, but it's a nice brain workout to just sit down and solve some puzzles. The game mechanic is so simple yet so unique that it makes this game amazing.
good game i highly recommend you get this
um dos melhores jogos do universo,inclui outros universos tambem.

The cake is a lie.

Portal is a puzzle game from Valve, originally packaged with The Orange Box, and was a surprise hit from the pack with such hits as Half-Life 2, Team Fortress 2, Half-Life 2 Episode 1 & 2. 

You are Chell, and you are an Aperture Science experiment, and you are guided through the test trials by GLaDOS, the lovable, but hated robot who's funny jokes and ironic sense of humor makes the game a lot more funny and hilarious at times, considering you are the only human in the whole game, no other humans are present in the game, but GLaDOS makes the game great.

In the later parts of the game, it can get quite challenging, but never so challenging that you would have to resort to YouTubing a guide, at least not for me. Portal was the best game out of The Orange Box, in my honest opinion, and for the price of £6.99, you can't go wrong with a bit of GLaDOS and cake. (P.S. The cake is a lie) 

I highly recommend that you pick up this game whenever you can, you will not regret it!
One of the greatest games I've ever played.
This game makes u think really hard by trying to get through each stage successfully
Loved it! Must-get, especially if you like puzzle games.
